results.adx_keywords: Food Contamination and Poisoning;Salmonella (Bacteria);Peanut Butter;Recalls and Bans of Products;Food and Drug Administration;JM Smucker Company
results.title: Several Jif Peanut Butter Products Recalled Over Potential Salmonella
results.abstract: The J.M. Smucker Company said it initiated a voluntary recall and advised consumers to dispose of some potentially contaminated products.

media.caption: The Jif products voluntarily recalled include several types of creamy, crunchy, reduced-fat and natural peanut butter in various sizes.
media.copyright: Paul Hennessy/SOPA Images, via AP Images

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Subways;Adams, Eric L;Enriquez, Daniel (d 2022);Manhattan (NYC);New York City
results.byline: By Ashley Southall and Nate Schweber
results.title: Man Fatally Shot on Manhattan Subway in Unprovoked Attack
results.abstract: A gunman shot and killed Daniel Enriquez, 48, on a Q train in Lower Manhattan on Sunday. “It’s horrific, this is a horror movie,” his sister said.

media.caption: Daniel Enriquez, 48, was shot in the chest by a gunman while riding a Q train on Sunday.

results.adx_keywords: Reading and Writing Skills (Education);Illiteracy;Dyslexia;Education (K-12);Teachers and School Employees;Content Type: Personal Profile;Calkins, Lucy;Teachers College of Columbia University
results.title: In the Fight Over How to Teach Reading, This Guru Makes a Major Retreat
results.abstract: Lucy Calkins, a leading literacy expert, has rewritten her curriculum to include a fuller embrace of phonics and the science of reading. Critics may not be appeased.

media.caption: Lucy Calkins, an education professor, created a popular curriculum called “Units of Study,” built on a vision of children as natural readers and writers.
media.copyright: Evelyn Freja for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Monkeypox;Disease Rates;Epidemics;Biden, Joseph R Jr;World Health Organization;Africa;Boston (Mass);Europe
results.title: ‘Everybody Should Be Concerned’ About Monkeypox, Biden Warns
results.abstract: Only one case of the virus has so far been identified in the U.S., but public health officials say the disease is likely to spread.

media.caption: Examining a patient infected with monkeypox in 2018 in the Central African Republic. The disease is endemic in parts of Africa.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);United States International Relations;Defense and Military Forces;Donbas (Ukraine);Russia
results.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer, Maria Varenikova and Ivor Prickett
results.title: Powerful American Artillery Enters the Fight in Ukraine
results.abstract: The most lethal weapons the West has provided so far to Ukraine are now deployed in combat. Will they make a critical difference for Ukraine’s military in a war that has mostly become an artillery battle?

media.caption: A gun crew of the 55th Separate Artillery Brigade of Ukraine’s Armed Forces, fired a Howitzer M777 155mm artillery piece towards Russian positions in the Donetsk region of Ukraine.
media.copyright: Ivor Prickett for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Cycling, Road;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Wilson, Anna Moriah;Armstrong, Kaitlin Marie;Strickland, Colin;Austin (Tex)
results.title: Mystery of Star Cyclist’s Murder Deepens as Police Seek Suspect
results.abstract: Kaitlin Marie Armstrong is being sought in the killing of Anna Moriah Wilson, according to the police, who said both women were romantically involved with the same man.

media.caption: Anna Moriah Wilson was a rising talent in off-road and gravel biking. She was in Texas to compete in a race when she was killed in Austin this month.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Defense and Military Forces;Politics and Government;International Relations;United States International Relations;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Kishida, Fumio;Taiwan;United States;Japan
results.byline: By Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Peter Baker
results.title: Biden Pledges to Defend Taiwan if It Faces a Chinese Attack
results.abstract: Moving away from a policy of “strategic ambiguity,” the president said that to protect the island democracy, he would go beyond what the U.S. has done for Ukraine.

results.adx_keywords: News and News Media;Television;Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Conspiracy Theories;Content Type: Personal Profile;Logan, Lara;CBS News;Fox Nation
results.title: Lara Logan, Once a Star at CBS News, Is Now One for the Far Right
results.abstract: The former chief foreign affairs correspondent is now a popular guest on podcasts hosted by vaccine skeptics and deniers of the 2020 election.

media.caption: Lara Logan in 2016. Some of her former CBS News colleagues recalled that when they worked together, her politics were not always easy to categorize.

results.byline: By Isaac Aronow and Doug Mennella
results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.byline: By Nick Cumming-Bruce and Anton Troianovski
results.title: A Russian diplomat resigns: ‘Never have I been so ashamed of my country.’
results.abstract: Boris Bondarev, a counselor at the Russian mission in Geneva, quit in a rare example of an official breaking with the Kremlin over its war in Ukraine.

media.caption: The United Nations offices in Geneva.

results.title: Pence, Tiptoeing Away From Trump, Lays Groundwork for ’24 Run
results.abstract: The former vice president is part of a group of Republicans who have visited early nominating states as they weigh a challenge to their party’s most dominant force.

media.caption: Former Vice President Mike Pence was in Iowa last month as he weighs a presidential run.
media.copyright: Rachel Mummey for The New York Times

results.title: ‘S.N.L.’ Says Goodbye to Multiple Cast Members
results.abstract: Kate McKinnon, Pete Davidson and Aidy Bryant each got to take a victory lap in a “Saturday Night Live” season finale hosted by Natasha Lyonne.

results.title: How Serious Is Monkeypox?
results.abstract: This viral illness is not like Covid, but there is cause for concern. Here’s how experts are thinking about it now.

results.title: Guy Fieri, Elder Statesman of Flavortown
results.abstract: TV’s spike-haired rhapsodist of roadside eats is still playing it for laughs. But he’s also winning food-world respect as a sort of graying eminence.

media.caption: Mr. Fieri’s red Camaro is a signature emblem of “Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives,” his flagship Food Network show.
media.copyright: Timothy O'Connell for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Vaccination and Immunization;Monkeypox;Smallpox;Disease Rates;Epidemics;Stockpiling;Homosexuality and Bisexuality;Centers for Disease Control and Prevention;European Center for Disease Prevention and Control;Canary Islands;Europe;Spain;United States
results.title: As Monkeypox Cases Rise, Nations Are Urged to Examine Vaccine Stores
results.abstract: The United States has stockpiled millions of doses of two smallpox vaccines, also effective against monkeypox. But the outbreaks so far are clustered in other countries.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
European Center for Disease Prevention and Control

media.caption: A colored scan of the monkeypox virus. As of Monday, there were more than 100 confirmed cases in 14 countries, with dozens more under investigation.

results.byline: By Sabrina Tavernise, Rikki Novetsky, Michael Johnson, Will Reid, Asthaa Chaturvedi, Kaitlin Roberts, Marc Georges, John Ketchum, Mike Benoist, Marion Lozano, Elisheba Ittoop and Chris Wood
results.title: A Tactical Disaster for Russia’s Military
results.abstract: A failed crossing of the Donets River in eastern Ukraine led to heavy losses for Russian troops and rare criticism of the Kremlin’s war efforts.

media.caption: A destroyed Russian vehicle in Bucha, Ukraine. Battlefield failures have exposed what some Russian bloggers are saying is incompetent leadership.
media.copyright: Daniel Berehulak for The New York Times

results.byline: By Kate Kelly and David D. Kirkpatrick
results.title: Kushner’s and Mnuchin’s Quick Pivots to Business With the Gulf
results.abstract: Weeks before the Trump administration ended, Jared Kushner and Steven Mnuchin met with future investors on official trips to the Middle East.

media.caption: Steven Mnuchin, center, then Treasury secretary, arriving at a 2019 conference in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

results.adx_keywords: Elections, Governors;Primaries and Caucuses;Perdue, David A Jr;Abrams, Stacey Y;Georgia
results.title: David Perdue makes racist remarks about Stacey Abrams as he ends a lackluster campaign.
results.abstract: Mr. Perdue, who badly trails Gov. Brian Kemp in the Republican primary for governor, accused Ms. Abrams of “demeaning her own race” in describing the state’s problems.

media.caption: Former Senator David Perdue, left, speaking in Dunwoody, Ga., on Monday alongside Peter Navarro, center, a former economic adviser to Donald J. Trump, and John Fredericks, a conservative radio host.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.title: ‘They basically got everything wrong’: A Russian diplomat speaks out on the war.
results.abstract: Boris Bondarev, a Russian official who resigned over the war in Ukraine, said his colleagues were focused more on pleasing their superiors than on delivering accurate information to Moscow.

media.caption: Boris Bondarev, right, at a United Nations meeting in Geneva this month.
